instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing SSD, Running hot
threads.message: Hey, got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> on the bench that posts to a flashing "?" folder, but will not recognize SSD. When I try to use External USB it will not show up. Two things I noticed were it draws about .700 to .9 A and the CPU gets super hot. Not sure where to start with this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing SSD, Running hot
threads.message:
So internal SSD is not showed by Disk Utility?
In such case, check L3700 and post <CHIP>U3740</CHIP> voltages, with SSD inserted.

Any history available?
Did you try another SSD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing SSD, Running hot
threads.message: No history, No corrosion that I could see. I cannot get to disk utility because it will not see USB either. I will try a couple other SSDs and post voltages soon.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not recognizing SSD, Running hot
threads.message:
I was thinking you cannot see internal SSD when boot through USB.
So you cannot access boot menu at all?
